parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>game2</name>=<value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game2 name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>version2</name>=<value> 1.99 </value></part><part><name>Game2 version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Positions </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the object position height above sea level. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[Array]] <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> '''getPosASL''' object </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - format [[PositionASL]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_AslPos = [[getPosASL]] [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[hint]] [[format]] ["position above sea level: %1", ([[getPosASL]] [[player]]) [[select]] 2];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[getPosASLVisual]], [[setPosASL]], [[setPosASL2]], [[position]], [[getPos]], [[getPosATL]], [[getPosASLW]], [[visiblePosition]], [[visiblePositionASL]], [[getTerrainHeightASL]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 23 Feb, 2007
<dt class="note">[[User:Dr_Eyeball|Dr_Eyeball]]
<dd class="note">
<code>[[getPosASL]] _obj [[select]] 2;</code> 
might sometimes return the vertical position above sea level, but over land for stacked objects, it returns the vertical position above the object beneath it or at least affected by this offset. The same problem exists for [[getPos]]. There was a [http://www.flashpoint1985.com/cgi-bin/ikonboard311/ikonboard.cgi?s=e587356595b907e91f96b8817d7f8a26;act=ST;f=71;t=57918 discussion] thread in the BIS forums which suggested the use of the command [[modelToWorld]] instead to get around this issue where an absolute vertical position is required. ArmA Ver '''1.02'''.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 27 Mar, 2014
<dt class="note">[[User:Floriangeyer|Floriangeyer]]
<dd class="note">
According to [[Code Optimisation]], this function is the fastest (2x) and should be used instead of [[getPos]], [[getPosATL]] and [[position]].
Conversion keep this speed ratio and is structured like: <code>[[ASLtoATL]] [[getPosASL]] [[Object]];</code>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on June 1, 2018 - 09:36 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Tankbuster|Tankbuster]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Further to Florians post, getPosASL is indeed faster than position and getpos, but is no faster that getposATL
